# HIDDeviceClient

**Class**

A client of a physical or virtual HID compatible peripheral.

## Declaration

```swift
actor HIDDeviceClient
```

## Overview

A human interface device (HID) is a computer peripheral intended to provide direction to the system from human input. The specification is a broad, industry-wide standard, maintained by the USB Implementers Forum. For more details, see [https://www.usb.org/hid].

A [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient] is a connection to one HID device on the system. It’s created using a [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/DeviceReference-swift.struct], received from a [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceManager]. A [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/DeviceReference-swift.struct] is a simple reference to a specific HID device. The HID peripheral can be a USB device like a wired mouse, a Bluetooth device like a wireless keyboard, an onboard sensor like an accelerometer, or even a software based, virtual peripheral created using [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDVirtualDevice].

A [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient] receives device notifications, such as input HID reports that are dispatched from the device in response to human input (like a keyboard key press) in [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/monitorNotifications(reportIDsToMonitor:elementsToMonitor:)]. It sends get and set reports to the device to retrieve information or configure device functionality using [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/dispatchSetReportRequest(type:id:data:timeout:)]. [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDDeviceClient/dispatchGetReportRequest(type:id:timeout:)]. It monitors or updates specific pieces of the HID report using [doc://com.apple.CoreHID/documentation/CoreHID/HIDElement].

## Create a device client

- **init(deviceReference:)**: Creates a client for a HID device.
- **HIDDeviceClient.DeviceReference**: A reference to a HID device on the system.
- **deviceReference**: The reference to the HID device used to create the  HID client device.

## Get device information

- **descriptor**: The HID specification compliant report descriptor for the associated HID device.
- **deviceUsages**: A convenient list of all the usages that the device supports.
- **isBuiltIn**: A Boolean value that determines whether the device is built-in to the system or an external peripheral.
- **localizationCode**: A location code that specifies the HID compliant localization code, if there is one.
- **locationID**: The location ID for the device, if there is one.
- **manufacturer**: The manufacturer of the device, if known.
- **modelNumber**: The model number for the device, if known.
- **primaryUsage**: The HID specification compliant usage for the device.
- **product**: The product name for the device, if known.
- **productID**: The product ID for the device.
- **serialNumber**: The serial number of the device, if known.
- **transport**: The data transport for the device.
- **uniqueID**: A unique ID for the device, if there is one.
- **vendorID**: The vendor ID for the device.
- **versionNumber**: The version of the device, if known.
- **elements**: All HID elements associated with the device.

## Interact with the device

- **dispatchGetReportRequest(type:id:timeout:)**: Send a get report request to the device over the transport.
- **dispatchSetReportRequest(type:id:data:timeout:)**: Send a set report request to the device over the transport.
- **seizeDevice()**: Attempt to obtain the device so that this client is the only active client.

## Monitor device notifications

- **monitorNotifications(reportIDsToMonitor:elementsToMonitor:)**: Creates an asynchronous that receives notifications about the associated device.
- **HIDDeviceClient.Notification**: Notifications for a HID device.

## Update element values

- **updateElements(_:timeout:)**: Provide new update values for, or request current values from, lists of elements.
- **HIDDeviceClient.RequestElementUpdate**: A request to pull the current value from a list of HID elements
- **HIDDeviceClient.ProvideElementUpdate**: A structure that provides values for a list of HID elements.
- **HIDDeviceClient.HIDElementUpdateResult**: A class to hold the results of an element update.

## Structures

- **HIDDeviceClient.UnsafeProperty**: A wrapper around an object to facilitate working with subscripts.

## Subscripts

- **subscript(_:)**: Get or set a property from the device.

## Interaction

- **Communicating with human interface devices**: Interact with and obtain data from devices such as keyboards and mice.
- **HIDElement**: A representation of an item from a report descriptor for a HID device.
- **HIDElementCollection**: A collection of items from a report descriptor for a HID device.
- **HIDElement.Value**: Data associated with a HID element.
- **HIDElementUpdate**: A base protocol for element update types.
- **HIDReportType**: Types for HID reports.
- **HIDReportID**: A type to represent the report IDs of HID reports.
- **HIDUsage**: A type to represent HID usage pages.
- **HIDDeviceError**: Errors that the framework can throw.
- **HIDDeviceTransport**: Common transport types that transmit data to or from a HID device.
- **HIDDeviceLocalizationCode**: The localization codes that some HID devices declare to specify conformance to a certain format or language.

## Conforms To

- Actor
- Copyable
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
